introduction.title: Welcome to the Next Level
introduction.content: One day you decided to start day trading, to delve into the topic and to develop yourself further. You set out to find like-minded people and came across this server. Here on the server, you've already reached level 4 and are currently reading this text. You seem to be really serious about this!

mindset_overview.title: The Mindset - The Core of Trading
mindset_overview.content: Mindset translates roughly to 'one's own way of thinking' and is one of the most important aspects of trading. It's often said that 20% of trading is about knowledge, while 80% is about mindset. I can only confirm this! But what exactly is this 'mindset' all about?

key_pillars.description: The most important point is discipline. Discipline in trading as well as in other areas of life. You cannot be a disciplined trader if you are undisciplined in all other areas.

subpoints.general_life: Always prioritize tasks that need to be done over your leisure time, stay persistent, don't give up, be consistent, and allow no exceptions.
subpoints.during_trading: While trading, you must follow your own trading plan, adhere to your written-down rules, be patient, and not allow impulsive decisions.
subpoints.post_trading: After trading, document your actions every single day without exception in your trading journal (recommended channel: #1-trading-journal) and be prepared to review everything again at the end of the week. Be ready to put in a lot of work to find mistakes in your trading, make improvements, and implement them.

key_pillars.challenge: You are now aware of what it means to be disciplined. There are many more points, examples, and aspects of discipline... which would go beyond the scope of a single text. Prove your discipline to yourself and after this training, independently research more points on this topic. (Very few will actually do this, so be the exception!)

key_pillars.description: Emotions are a major reason why most people fail in the stock market. Many trades are entered to recoup losses, because one feels the urge to rake in big profits, etc.
guidelines: As already said regarding discipline, you must stick to your own trading plan; emotions have no place there.
Make your trading decisions not based on feeling, but on data and facts provided by your own analysis.
Be aware that trading is a game of probabilities and losses are part of it. Without losses, you are unable to generate profits.
Trust your own strategy, don't get excited about your wins, don't be sad, frustrated, or angry about your losses. Instead, view everything with 100% objectivity.

key_pillars.description: Maintain a positive and resilient attitude for the long haul.
principles: Always stay positive and don't let negativity get to you.
Always be prepared to take the longer and harder path.
Think long-term and don't focus on quick success.
Be a strong character, don't let anyone talk you into things that throw you off your path.
Create a mental and physical balance for yourself, e.g., through sports.
Don't shy away from investing in yourself and your knowledge (books, courses, mentoring...). The best investment is always in yourself!

conclusion.title: The Journey Ahead
conclusion.content: The topic of mindset is incredibly extensive and is not concluded with this training. I have tried to give you the best foundation, but I urge you to absolutely do your own research again and take the #1-book-recommendations to heart.
conclusion.final_message: The path to becoming a profitable trader is long and hard! Look forward to this journey instead of fearing it, stay consistently on the ball, allow no exceptions, and let trading become your priority.
